meanings.definition: Make a vibrant or trilling sound, as of a bird.
meanings.sent1: The robin churred happily in the tree.
meanings.sent2: The canary churred a beautiful melody.
meanings.sent3: The churring bird seemed to be singing a cheerful tune.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter churred like a bird in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the flute churred through the forest, enchanting all who heard.

meanings.definition: To make a low, continuous, vibratory sound, as of a machine.
meanings.sent1: The old car churred as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent2: The generator churred softly in the background.
meanings.sent3: The washing machine churred rhythmically, lulling me to sleep.
meanings.sent4: The engine churred like a contented cat.
meanings.sent5: The factory churred all night, never resting in its work.
